meanings.sent1: She kept redoubling her efforts to finish the puzzle.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to redouble their study efforts for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent3: The chef's redoubling of the secret ingredient made the dish taste even better.
meanings.sent4: The sound of the drums redoubling in the distance signaled the start of the parade.
meanings.sent5: The redoubling of the waves crashing against the shore created a soothing rhythm.

meanings.sent1: The company decided to redouble its marketing budget for better results.
meanings.sent2: By adding more spices, she redoubled the flavor of the soup.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved redoubling the number of colorful scarves he pulled out of his hat.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's determination redoubled after winning the first race.
meanings.sent5: The redoubling of the number of attendees at the event exceeded all expectations.

meanings.sent1: The storm redoubled in strength, causing widespread damage.
meanings.sent2: The applause from the audience redoubled as the singer hit a high note.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jokes redoubled the laughter in the room.
meanings.sent4: The smell of fresh bread baking in the oven redoubled our hunger.
meanings.sent5: The redoubling of the city's population led to a housing shortage.
